page.title: 15LEISURE - CRESSBROOK WARDLOW
page.content: {The Cressbrook Brass Band }was founded in 1881. Apart from one family from Wardlow, most members live in the village. They play in annual village wakes and nearby village carnivals. {Fishing }is popular in the river Wye in Water cum Jolly Dale, and in a pond near Wardlow Myers.The fishing rights are let to Sheffield Angling Clubs. {The Village Hall}at Wardlow is used for whist drives and social gatherings especially at Christmas when there is a village pantomine or concert in which all the villagers participate. {The National Nature Reserve }near Ravensdale Cottages is well known to botanists for the variety of wild flowers found there. {Rock Climbing }is popular with people from outside the area,as is{Pot-holing {Cycles }may be hired from Monsal Head.
